title: Arsenal news: Danny Welbeck says Per Mertesacker helped him through 'dark' injury period | Metro News
text:
George Bellshaw for Metro.co.uk Thursday 23 Feb 2017 2:34 pm 
Danny Welbeck has revealed how Per Mertesacker helped him through a difficult period while he was injured. Keep smiling! Mourinho of all people melts hearts with touching message to Ranieri 
The Arsenal striker suffered severe damage to his knee cartilage in a draw against Manchester City back in May and only recently returned to action. 
Welbeck admitted it was a tough time for him away from the action on the pitch but the Arsenal captain helped him through. 
‘Obviously we’ve both had long-term knee injuries,’ he said. 
‘He’s one of the sickest guys on the road I’m serious. Welbeck is thankful for Mertesacker’s help (Picture: Getty) 
‘He just lifts the whole mood and atmosphere in the dressing room. He helped me a lot obviously being out injured, he’s always there talking to you and giving you advice. 
‘Being injured for so long can be a pretty dark place but Per was one of the reasons I kept smiling.
